meanings.definition: To make a shrill, high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: The bird yirred loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard a yirr coming from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The cat yirred at the sight of a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The whistle yirred through the air like a sharp arrow.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock's yirr woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: A loud, shrill cry or call.
meanings.sent1: The yirr of the siren pierced the silence.
meanings.sent2: She let out a yirr of excitement when she won the game.
meanings.sent3: The yirr of the baby made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The yirr of the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent5: The yirr of the thunder echoed through the valley.
